body:
I'm having the same issue. Vagrant [assumes](https://github.com/mitchellh/vagrant/search?q=initctl&type=Code) that an OS uses Upstart if `/sbin/initctl` is present. But this is not always the case, for example `systemd-sysv` Ubuntu package registers systemd as init daemon, but doesn't remove `/sbin/initctl` binary.

The first workaround I have tried is removing `upstart` and `upstart-bin` packages. This removes `sbin/initctl` binary, but also stops Upstart daemon, breaking `shutdown` (and probably other essential commands) until you hard-reboot the VM.

The second workaround is `chmod a-x /sbin/initctl`. It works, but obviously is the wrong way of doing things :)

I think Vagrant should ignore errors from this command. Unfortunately, it was copied to non-core plugins, e.g. [vagrant-parallels](https://github.com/Parallels/vagrant-parallels/blob/ee12f744584d9fad85d99445bafe7775c87d4a1a/lib/vagrant-parallels/guest_cap/linux/mount_parallels_shared_folder.rb#L83), so they need to be fixed too.

issue.title: Check Upstart is running before emitting upstart events.

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
Fixes issue #5377.
Check that Upstart is not just installed but currently actively running
before attempting to emit an event after mounting shared folders.
Only requires the binary be named upstart, not that it lives in /sbin.

body: Just ran into this today, hence the PR. If accepted, I'll look into sending similar PRs to non-core plugins as well.

// , I also have this issue, and got the following spew from my terminal: dpaste.de/8fhp

Need I provision this machine to use Upstart instead of SystemD? 

P.S. Much hate, have I, for the SystemD. 
Maybe Snappy doesn't use it.

repository.description: Virtual machine templates for Ubuntu written in legacy JSON

```
/sbin/initctl emit --no-wait vagrant-mounted MOUNTPOINT=/vagrant

# if Makefile.local exists, include it
ifneq ("$(wildcard Makefile.local)", "")
        include Makefile.local
endif

PACKER ?= packer

# Possible values for CM: (nocm | chef | chefdk | salt | puppet)
CM ?= nocm
# Possible values for CM_VERSION: (latest | x.y.z | x.y)
CM_VERSION ?=
ifndef CM_VERSION
        ifneq ($(CM),nocm)
                CM_VERSION = latest
        endif
endif
BOX_VERSION ?= $(shell cat VERSION)
ifeq ($(CM),nocm)
        BOX_SUFFIX := -$(CM)-$(BOX_VERSION).box
else
        BOX_SUFFIX := -$(CM)$(CM_VERSION)-$(BOX_VERSION).box
endif

# Packer does not allow empty variables, so only pass variables that are defined
/filter
BOX_FILENAMES := $(TEMPLATE_FILENAMES:.json=$(BOX_SUFFIX))
Stdout from the command:



Stderr from the command:

stdin: is not a tty
initctl: Unable to connect to Upstart: Failed to connect to socket /com/ubuntu/upstart: Connection refused

make: *** [test-box/virtualbox/ubuntu1504-desktop-nocm-1.1.0.box] Error 1
```

issue.title: Windows - Orphan Network Adapters

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
We're using vagrant on a few windows 7 and windows 8 machines at work, however everybody is building up a nice collection of VirtualBox Host-Only Network adapters each time we create a new Vagrant box.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1094740/8668689/b1e6ddaa-2a05-11e5-9d8a-e438ea7f9854.png)

Wondering if there is a reason for this that we could resolve?

Thanks

body: This fix breaks the "vagrant-mounted" emit in all releases prior to 14.10, since /proc/1/exe is /sbin/init, so the condition added in 49ff17b9b925e947cdc18c51ff2607613716238f is never met.
@samuelgmartinez Whoops, you're right, I only tested 15.04 with upstart and systemd. I'm working on a fix now and should have a PR later today.

issue.title: VMWare Plugin

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
I recently upgraded the vagrant-vmware-workstation plugin from 3.2.9 to 3.2.11. Where I can find information about what has changed/been fixed? Surely there's a CHANGELOG available for us who have purchased the plugin?

If not, I think having a CHANGELOG available to the public would be helpful, especially for those waiting for provider specific issues to be resolved, like #5377

issue.title: Regression: vagrant-mounted event is not emitted on Ubuntu < 15.04

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
The fix for #5377 broke the "vagrant-mounted" Upstart event on the LTS versions of Ubuntu. Upstart services that depend on this event will not run.

The Upstart binary was renamed from /sbin/init to /sbin/upstart on 15.04, so the check introduced with 92e6062f8dbb461c8b0f0a3e59c6427385851083 will cause any version of Ubuntu older than 15.04 not to emit the event.

issue.title: Ubuntu 16.04 Desktop errors on `vagrant up` (only with vmware provider)

repository.name: ubuntu
repository.description: Virtual machine templates for Ubuntu written in legacy JSON

issue.body:
Using the `vmware_workstation` provider, I get this error on `vagrant up`:

```
Y:\repo\devops\tmp>vagrant up --provider vmware_workstation
Bringing machine 'default' up with 'vmware_workstation' provider...
==> default: Cloning VMware VM: 'boxcutter/ubuntu1604-desktop'. This can take some time...
==> default: Verifying vmnet devices are healthy...
==> default: Preparing network adapters...
==> default: Starting the VMware VM...
==> default: Waiting for machine to boot. This may take a few minutes...
    default: SSH address: 192.168.153.129:22
    default: SSH username: vagrant
    default: SSH auth method: private key
    default:
    default: Vagrant insecure key detected. Vagrant will automatically replace
    default: this with a newly generated keypair for better security.
    default:
    default: Inserting generated public key within guest...
    default: Removing insecure key from the guest if it's present...
    default: Key inserted! Disconnecting and reconnecting using new SSH key...
==> default: Machine booted and ready!
==> default: Forwarding ports...
    default: -- 22 => 2222
==> default: Configuring network adapters within the VM...
==> default: Configuring proxy for Apt...
==> default: Configuring proxy environment variables...
==> default: Waiting for HGFS to become available...
==> default: Enabling and configuring shared folders...
    default: -- Y:/repo/devops/tmp: /vagrant
The following SSH command responded with a non-zero exit status.
Vagrant assumes that this means the command failed!

/sbin/initctl emit --no-wait vagrant-mounted MOUNTPOINT=/vagrant

Stdout from the command:



Stderr from the command:

mesg: ttyname failed: Inappropriate ioctl for device
initctl: Unable to connect to Upstart: Failed to connect to socket /com/ubuntu/upstart: Connection refused
```

This was with the latest v2.0.22 boxcutter/ubuntu1604-desktop box from atlas:
https://atlas.hashicorp.com/boxcutter/boxes/ubuntu1604-desktop

My environment is Windows 7 with:

```
Y:\repo\devops\tmp>vagrant --version
Vagrant 1.8.5

Y:\repo\devops\tmp>vagrant plugin list
vagrant-cachier (1.2.1)
  - Version Constraint: 1.2.1
vagrant-managed-servers (0.8.0.dev)
  - Version Constraint: 0.8.0.dev
vagrant-proxyconf (1.5.2)
  - Version Constraint: 1.5.2
vagrant-share (1.1.5, system)
vagrant-vmware-workstation (4.0.13)

Y:\repo\devops\tmp>"C:\Program Files (x86)\VMware\VMware Workstation\vmrun.exe" --version
Invalid argument: --version
vmrun version 1.15.2 build-3272444

Y:\repo\devops\tmp>vagrant box list
boxcutter/ubuntu1604            (vmware_desktop, 2.0.22)
boxcutter/ubuntu1604-desktop    (vmware_desktop, 2.0.22)
```

Please note that the v2.0.22 "boxcutter/ubuntu1604-desktop" for virtualbox provider works as expected and does not run into this error.

I also tested the "boxcutter/ubuntu1604" server box, and this even works with the vmware_provider. It's just the "boxcutter/ubuntu1604-desktop" box which does not work with vmware

issue.title: Synced folder for current directory fails

repository.name: ubuntu
repository.description: Virtual machine templates for Ubuntu written in legacy JSON

issue.body:
I am facing issue mounting default `/vagrant` synced folder when using `config.vm.box = "boxcutter/ubuntu1604-desktop"` to create Parallels VM.
```
==> default: Mounting shared folders...
    default: /vagrant => /Users/dvolosnykh/Develop
The following SSH command responded with a non-zero exit status.
Vagrant assumes that this means the command failed!

/sbin/initctl emit --no-wait vagrant-mounted MOUNTPOINT=/vagrant

Stdout from the command:



Stderr from the command:

initctl: Unable to connect to Upstart: Failed to connect to socket /com/ubuntu/upstart: Connection refused
```

Disabling this synced folder allows to proceed further, but only to fail on next mount.
